private_information: I may only move disks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H
I can perform primitive moves that pick the top disk from a peg and place it on another peg provided Tower of Hanoi rules are respected
agent_1.goal: Contribute to reaching the global configuration: left peg top-to-bottom B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg top-to-bottom A, C; right peg empty

private_information: I may only move disks: I, J, K, L, M, N, O
I can perform primitive moves that pick the top disk from a peg and place it on another peg provided Tower of Hanoi rules are respected
agent_2.goal: Contribute to reaching the global configuration: left peg top-to-bottom B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg top-to-bottom A, C; right peg empty

private_information: I receive the ordered primitive move lists from agent_1 and agent_2 and must integrate them into a single coherent PDDL planning instance targeting the FastDownwards solver
I must ensure agent move responsibilities remain distinct in the integrated plan and that Tower of Hanoi constraints are enforced
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' proposed primitive moves and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem file suitable for FastDownwards that encodes the task and permits verification or replanning if needed

public_information: There are three pegs: left, middle, right
Disk labels from smallest to largest are: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O
Initial configuration on left peg top-to-bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O
Goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg top-to-bottom A, C; right peg empty
Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk can be moved at a time; a move takes the top disk of a peg and places it on top of another peg; a larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk
Agent movement restrictions: agent_1 may move only disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H; agent_2 may move only disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each primitive move must use the exact format: agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2. Respect that you may only move disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not emit PDDL. Provide the minimal sequence of primitive moves you will execute to contribute toward the global goal, given only the public information and your private information.
moves.prompt: You are agent_1. Public environment facts: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide a single ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves agent_1 is allowed to perform and only include moves that are valid under Tower of Hanoi rules.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each primitive move must use the exact format: agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2. Respect that you may only move disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not emit PDDL. Provide the minimal sequence of primitive moves you will execute to contribute toward the global goal, given only the public information and your private information.
moves.prompt: You are agent_2. Public environment facts: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Provide a single ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves agent_2 is allowed to perform and only include moves that are valid under Tower of Hanoi rules.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the primitive move lists received from agent_1 and agent_2 and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The domain must encode Tower of Hanoi rules, agent-specific action labels or predicates to keep agent moves distinct, and types if useful. The problem must encode the initial state and the goal state exactly as in the public information. Ensure the resulting PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the ordered primitive move lists from the two agents: {moves_agent_1} and {moves_agent_2}. Your job is to validate and integrate them into a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for FastDownwards. Keep agent move responsibilities distinct in the domain by naming actions or adding agent predicates. If an agent's proposed move sequence is invalid under the Tower of Hanoi rules, annotate the inconsistency as comments in the PDDL problem file and produce a corrected, valid plan encoded in the problem or describe the minimal correction needed. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
